intro: Centaurea transcaucasica subsp. transcaucasica, commonly known as the Transcaucasian centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to temperate climates. It produces small, bracteate heads of florets, with both ray and disc flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and morphological traits.
